channel.title: I Need Help!
channel.description: Hey! I am a complete N00B at this! I have taken a few computer science courses in highschool (where I am currently) and have been playing rs for a long time. I never even knew there was anything like this. I really want to make at least just a simple client to start. I would love the source code to a client but it would be amazing if there was even a tutorial with it :) I was wondering if someone could help me. :palm: :confused:

item.title: I Need Help!
item.dc:creator: @Hyperon Hyperon
item.description:
@Hyperon wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:10, topic:548359”]Being honest at his stage I doubt he cares about what downloads what as long as he can play and edit.

You’ll find that most servers come with a client, both of which you can edit and mess around with. For example, this is an example from the downloads section, that server comes with both a client and server. There are also many other servers, some better or worse than others in that section. You can probably find a standalone server or client in that section also if you search for one.

Any server tutorials can be found in this section and its subsections. You’ll be able to find a few client tutorials in this section if you’re stuck.[/quote]

Informing about “making a client” was necessary so he understands how it all works, as he was asking the wrong question.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help!
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Being honest at his stage I doubt he cares about what downloads what as long as he can play and edit.

You’ll find that most servers come with a client, both of which you can edit and mess around with. For example, this is an example from the downloads section, that server comes with both a client and server. There are also many other servers, some better or worse than others in that section. You can probably find a standalone server or client in that section also if you search for one.

Any server tutorials can be found in this section and its subsections. You’ll be able to find a few client tutorials in this section if you’re stuck.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’m not arguing on either side here.
I’m just gonna say… If you go to runescape and view-source their page… You can find the applet.

Note: You’ll have to find the iframe for the page, and then view source THAT page to get the .jar.

Here is a link to one: (don’t believe me, go do it yourself…) http://world6a.runescape.com/gamepacklsP0p8mvNFWryKP38Bd5mXu9Yyn7HgWs_2132957.jar

The mainclass is Rs2Applet, and they have a bunch of parameters you gotta pass for it to load…

[code=html5]

Install RuneScape to start playing

1. Download

2. Run

3. Install

4. Play

Download RuneScape
Advanced users: Play in your browser with Java
[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help!
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

the applet on any of jagexs sites, are not clients.

and how tf do u export a pack200 into a cache

u get the client from the cache, not the other way around u turd

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help!
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:6, topic:548359”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=667266.msg4463378#msg4463378 date=1418751877]

You don’t make a client because when you receive the cache from Jagex to play RuneScape, people extract the client from the cache and “hack” it so it is open source (then decompile, deobfuscate and sometimes refactor).

You create (or most likely just edit) a server, which your client (and other players) connects to. Then when you click on your client, your server interprets the command/task and you see it update on your screen (i.e. clicking minimap to walk, clicking items etc.).

Check the download section and the tutorial section.

No, you have it the wrong way around. You download and run the client, which downloads the cache. Also I don’t think you conceptually understand what open source is.

No I’m talking about getting a deob from Jagex’s cache when you play their game, not private servers.

My point still applies.
[/quote]the client applet you download from runescape is not a client. it is a launcher.
your point doesn’t apply as jagex / ps are on two different levels.

we dont have to download some kiddies cache and get the jar from the pack200 file.

so ur ‘point’ is whac.[/quote]you have no idea what you’re talking about… the client downloads the deob which lets you pull out the pack200 file and export it into an open source jagex ltd cache.

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help!

item.description:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:5, topic:548359”][quote author=Hyperon link=topic=667266.msg4463358#msg4463358 date=1418738066]

You don’t make a client because when you receive the cache from Jagex to play RuneScape, people extract the client from the cache and “hack” it so it is open source (then decompile, deobfuscate and sometimes refactor).

You create (or most likely just edit) a server, which your client (and other players) connects to. Then when you click on your client, your server interprets the command/task and you see it update on your screen (i.e. clicking minimap to walk, clicking items etc.).

Check the download section and the tutorial section.

No, you have it the wrong way around. You download and run the client, which downloads the cache. Also I don’t think you conceptually understand what open source is.

No I’m talking about getting a deob from Jagex’s cache when you play their game, not private servers.
[/quote]

My point still applies.[/quote]the client applet you download from runescape is not a client. it is a launcher.
your point doesn’t apply as jagex / ps are on two different levels.

we dont have to download some kiddies cache and get the jar from the pack200 file.

so ur ‘point’ is whac.

Read full topic
